tracks.text: Soldiers in uniform turn to the left, then forward. A bald man walks past them.
The bald man walks casually between cement pillars, past blinking computers and glowing lights, down some steps, into a cement atrium.
A man is handcuffed to a table. He wears black trousers, a white dress shirt, and a bow tie.
A large, red laser machine points at the bow tie man.
The bald man turns a dial.
The bald man turns slightly. He's singing. His nose and part of his face is covered in gold.
The bow tie man looks nervous.
The bald man turns around.
He strokes a torture implement.
He steps lightly and spins in place.
He takes a device from a person in a lab coat, then dances back to the table.
He looks at the device. The laser machine glows. The bow tie man looks up, worried.
5 o'clock. A red light blares. The bow tie man looks around. The bald man drops his hands, hangs his head, and sighs.
The bald man walks into the kitchen of a suburban home. A girl smiles at him. He smiles back.
The bald man, his wife, and their 2 children sit at a table. The wife puts food on a plate. He stares vacantly.
The wife stares at him uncertainly. At night, he sits up in bed.
He stares off distantly. The bow tie man sleeps on the table.
The bald man grimaces, and gets out of bed.
In the cement atrium, the bald man flails. He spins around, windmills his arms, drops to the floor, the rises.
He runs across the atrium, throws himself at a wall, and beats his fists. The bow tie man watches.
The bald man dances back to the table, spinning around, shaking his fist, and windmilling his arms. Soldiers walk behind him, singing.
The bald man angrily grabs a device from a man in a lab coat. He points at another one. Electricity crackles between lights and the laser machine.
The bow tie man shakes his head.
The bald man readies his finger to press a button, pauses, and turns around. The bow tie man sighs.
He hovers over a red button, labeled Kill. The bald man sings.
He lifts his finger. A green button is labeled Release.
He presses the green button. The handcuffs come apart.
The bow tie man jumps up. Soldiers approach, guns ready. The bald man raises a hand.
The bald man waves his hand. The bow tie man runs.
The bow tie man pauses and sings.
The bow tie man turns around and sings at the bald man.
He dances. The bald man stares and smiles.
The press their palms out, then spin in circles, pressing palms on each turn. Soldiers pat their legs to the beat.
They step backwards, holding arms up. They clasp fists, step, look either side. Bow tie man lifts bald man, they roll their chests together, then leap back.
They kick to the side, hold out arms, and begin to dance in sync.
The bald man walks into his kitchen. The kids and the bow tie man, now wearing a turtleneck, greet him.
In the atrium, the men dance, mirroring each other's movements.
They kick up, step back, bend down, rise, circle legs out, and leap while spinning. They dance forward, lunging.
In a warmly lit kitchen, the bald and bowtie men sit at a table, smiling.
The bald man dishes food for the kids. The bow tie man holds a martini glass.
The bow tie man looks from the son, to the daughter, to the bald man.
In the atrium, in matching doorways, the men leap, then spin around, arms outstretched.
At night, the men sit up in bed. The bow tie man, in the wife's place, drinks a martini and reads the paper. The bald man reads a book and smiles.
The men dance in the atrium, while soldiers walk on the floors above them.
The bow tie man puts his martini down. The bald man looks at him, looks forward, and smiles.
Our view turns green. We zoom out, looking at a screen.
A woman watches the screen inside the cement atrium.
The woman stares intently. Cut to black. White text on a red background read, Miike Snow's Genghis Khan! A Motion Picture Spectacular!
Cut to black
